title: ICE: assertion failed: ty::type_is_sized(bcx.tcx(), contents_ty)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
``` rust
fn main() {
    let _x: Box<str> = box *"hello world";
    // or
    let array: &[int] = &[1, 2, 3];
    let _x: Box<[int]> = box *array;
}
```

This seemingly is caused by [`trans_uniq_expr`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/librustc/middle/trans/expr.rs#L1488) assuming that the type being boxed is sized. This assertion is not present in the equivalent for `&`-pointers, `trans_addr_of`.
